Description: Painted wooden shabti of Neb-[...] with a black curled lappet-wig, a red modelled face with black and white eyes and a black and red collar that encloses the crossed red hands in relief; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a a column of black painted Hieroglyphs(damaged); the back is has a red seed-basket; much of the foot section has broken away.
Condition: incomplete - section missing from foot and leg
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
